abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p><jats:italic>Purpose</jats:italic>: Lobular breast cancer (LBC) accounts for ~ 15% of breast cancer. Here, we studied the frequency of pathogenic germline variants (PGVs) in an extended panel of genes in women affected with LBC. <jats:italic>Methods</jats:italic>: 302 women with LBC and 1567 without breast cancer were tested for <jats:italic>BRCA1/2</jats:italic> PGVs. A subset of 134 LBC affected women who tested negative for <jats:italic>BRCA1/2</jats:italic> PGVs underwent extended screening, including: <jats:italic>ATM, CDH1, CHEK2, NBN, PALB2, PTEN, RAD50, RAD51D,</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>TP53.</jats:italic><jats:italic>Results</jats:italic>: 35 PGVs were identified in the group with LBC, of which 22 were in <jats:italic>BRCA1/2</jats:italic>. Ten actionable PGVs were identified in additional genes (<jats:italic>ATM</jats:italic>(4), <jats:italic>CDH1</jats:italic>(1), <jats:italic>CHEK2</jats:italic>(1), <jats:italic>PALB2</jats:italic>(2) and <jats:italic>TP53</jats:italic>(2)). Overall, PGVs in three genes conferred a significant increased risk for LBC. Odds ratios (ORs) were: <jats:italic>BRCA1</jats:italic>: OR = 13.17 (95%CI 2.83–66.38; P = 0.0017), <jats:italic>BRCA2</jats:italic>: OR = 10.33 (95%CI 4.58–23.95; P < 0.0001); and <jats:italic>ATM:</jats:italic> OR = 8.01 (95%CI 2.52–29.92; P = 0.0053). We did not detect an increased risk of LBC for <jats:italic>PALB2, CDH1</jats:italic> or <jats:italic>CHEK2</jats:italic>. <jats:italic>Conclusion</jats:italic>: The overall PGV detection rate was 11.59%, with similar rates of <jats:italic>BRCA1/2</jats:italic> (7.28%) PGVs as for other actionable PGVs (7.46%), indicating a benefit for extended panel genetic testing in LBC. We also report a previously unrecognised association of pathogenic variants in <jats:italic>ATM</jats:italic> with LBC.</jats:p>

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: DGE has received travel grants from AstraZeneca. All other authors declare that they have no conflict of interest.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: Clinical or research consent was given for extended testing of breast cancer associated genes (approval from the North Manchester Research Ethics Committee (reference 09/H1008/81(PROCAS) and 08/H1006/77)).
